text: Anders Martin Fjell (born 17 April 1974) is a Norwegian psychologist, neuroscientist and Professor of Cognitive Psychology at the University of Oslo.Anders Fjell, University of Oslo Together with his wife, fellow neuroscientist Kristine Beate Walhovd, he established the Centre of Lifespan Changes in Brain and Cognition at the University of Oslo, which was given the status of "world leading research environment" by the Government of Norway in 2015.Utpekt til verdensledende hjerneforskereUiOs fem verdensledende forskningsmiljøer He and his wife shared the Fridtjof Nansen Prize in 2007.Hjerne og forstandsaktivitet i et livsløpsperspektiv He was elected as a member of the Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters in 2017. According to Google Scholar, he has been cited around 14,000 times in scientific literature and has an h-index of 67.Anders Fjell, Google Scholar ==References== Category:Living people Category:1974 births Category:Norwegian psychologists Category:Norwegian neuroscientists Category:Neuropsychologists Category:University of Oslo faculty Category:Members of the Norwegian Academy of Science and Letters
title: Anders Fjell
